name: Basic Snowflake
description: Standard Snowflake Method structure for any story

prompts.summary: Write a one-sentence summary of your entire story. Focus on the core conflict and character goal.
prompts.characters: Describe your main characters, their roles, motivations, and character arcs.
prompts.scenes: Outline the key scenes that drive your plot forward. Focus on major turning points.
prompts.notes: Add any additional notes, themes, research, or ideas that don't fit in other categories.

prompts.ordinary-world: Introduce your hero in their ordinary world. What's missing from their life?
prompts.call-to-adventure: What event calls your hero to adventure? What do they stand to gain or lose?
prompts.refusal: Why does your hero initially refuse the call? What fears or obligations hold them back?
prompts.mentor: Who guides your hero? What wisdom or gifts do they provide?
prompts.crossing: What point of no return does your hero cross? How is their world different now?
prompts.tests: What challenges does your hero face? Who helps and who hinders them?
prompts.approach: How does your hero approach their greatest challenge? What preparations do they make?
prompts.ordeal: What is the central crisis or ordeal? How does your hero face death (literal or metaphorical)?
prompts.reward: What does your hero gain from surviving the ordeal? (Knowledge, object, power, etc.)
prompts.road-back: How does your hero begin their return journey? What new challenges emerge?
prompts.resurrection: What final test purifies your hero? How are they transformed?
prompts.return: How does your hero return home changed? What elixir (literal or metaphorical) do they bring?

name: Three-Act Structure
description: Classic beginning, middle, and end structure

prompts.act1-setup: Introduce characters, setting, and the status quo. What's the world like before everything changes?
prompts.inciting-incident: What event disrupts the status quo and sets the story in motion?
prompts.act2-confrontation: How does the protagonist struggle against obstacles? What do they learn?
prompts.midpoint: What major event changes the direction of the story? How are the stakes raised?
prompts.act3-resolution: How is the main conflict resolved? What is the new status quo?
prompts.climax: What is the final, decisive confrontation? How does the protagonist prove their growth?
prompts.denouement: How are loose ends tied up? What is life like for the characters now?
